@mojitane Thanks! This is a good question, and an increasingly popular pattern. Both git-based (CMS makes changes to content in your git repo) or API-based (CMS gives you a UI and content into your build via an API) work well with JAMstack sites & @Netlify. See: https://t.co/Eke1BLW4rv
